neutral_message:
If everyone ate less animal foods, the CO2 from food production would drop by 68%. Just by changing our food choices, we could be halfway to stopping climate change.

Climate change will mostly affect us young people because we will see its outcomes in our lifetime. Instead of being cynical, let's look for small, effective changes that we can make right now. Choosing more plant-based meals or snacks when possible is one of the easiest things we can do.

You can also find out which foods are especially harmful for to climate (hint: the farm animal that is worst for the climate rhymes with â€˜wowâ€™).

neutral_message: More than 70% of farm animals in the UK are raised on factory farms to keep animal products cheap. On these farms, a chicken has only about the space of a laptop, so there's hardly any room to move. It's like living under a staircase, like Harry Potter, for your whole life.\n\nFactory farms keep going because people buy their products. By choosing to eat less meat or plant-based meats when we can, we can send a message to these farms to make better living conditions for their animals.

On these farms, a chicken has only about the space of a laptop, so there's hardly any room to move. It's like living under a staircase, like Harry Potter, for your whole life, ya know?

Factory farms keep going because people buy their products. By choosing to eat less meat or plant-based meats when we can, we can send a message to these farms to make better living conditions for their animals, you guys.
tst_explanation: I used 'Yo' and 'you guys' to mimic person X's use of informal and conversational language. I also added filler phrases like 'so like' and 'ya know?' to capture the narrative and casual tone. The use of 'Henlo' instead of 'Hello' suggests a playful or humorous tone, but since the target text is not humorous, I did not add any variations of 'haha'.

Factory farms keep going because people buy their products. But if we choose to eat less meat or plant-based meats when we can, we can send a message to these farms to make better living conditions for their animals, right?

They also tend to use informal language and phrasing, such as starting sentences with conjunctions ('But if we choose...'). I've incorporated these stylistic choices and maintained the use of pronouns like 'we' and 'you' to mimic their style.
